title: 1: Ampacities provided by this section do not take voltage drop into consideration
State of Massachusetts (add to 780 CMR, item 924.3): electrical fire pumps in many occupancies require emergency power per NFPA 20

State of Massachusetts (add to 527 CMR, NEC, Article 700): emergency system feeders, generation and distribution equipment, including fire pumps, shall have a 2-h fire separation from all other spaces and equipment
The fire pump feeder conductors shall be physically routed outside the building or enclosed in 2 in of concrete (1-h equivalent fire resistance) except in the electrical switchgear or fire pump rooms

note: MI cable is added to this in the 1993 version).
title: All pump room wiring shall be in rigid, intermediate, or liquidtight flexible metal conduit
Maximum permissible voltage drop at the fire pump input terminals is 15 percent
Protective devices (fuses or circuit breakers) ahead of the fire pump shall not open at the sum of the locked rotor currents of the facility or the fire pump auxiliaries
The pump room feeder minimum size shall be 125 percent of the sum of the fire pump(s), jockey pump, and pump auxiliary fullload currents
Automatic load shed and sequencing of fire pumps is permitted
